O my King and my God.

Dòmine~; intèlleǧe clamórem meum. ^ Giv: Dòmine~; mane exáŭdies vocem meam. ^ For to thee will I pray
O Lord~; in the morning thou shalt hear my voice.

Dòmine~; intèlleǧe clamórem meum. ^ Giv: qŭóniam non Deus volens iniqŭitátem tu es. ^ In the morning I will stand before thee
column4: because thou art not a God that willest iniquity.

Dòmine~; intèlleǧe clamórem meum. ^ Giv: nèqŭe permanébunt injústi ante òculos tuos. ^ Neither shall the wicked dwell near thee
nor shall the unjust abide before thy eyes.

2 ^ Vèrba mea áŭribus pèrcipe: 7 ^ Odìsti òmnes qŭi operántur iniqŭitátem~; pèrdes òmnes
Dòmine~; intèlleǧe clamórem meum. ^ Giv: qŭi loqŭùntur mendácium. Vìrum sángŭinum et dolósum abominábitur Dòminus. ^ Thou hatest all the workers of iniquity~; thou wilt destroy all that speak a lie. The bloody and the deceitful man the Lord will abhor.

2 ^ Vèrba mea áŭribus pèrcipe: 8 ^ Ego aŭtem in multitúdine misericórdiaĕ tuaĕ
Dòmine~; intèlleǧe clamórem meum. ^ Giv: introíbo in domum tuam~; adorábo ad templum sanctum tuum in timóre tuo. ^ But as for me in the multitude of thy mercy
I will come into thy house~; I will worship towards thy holy temple

Dòmine~; intèlleǧe clamórem meum. ^ Giv: dedúce me in justìția tua~; pròpter inimícos meos díriǧe in conspèctu tuo viam meam. ^ Conduct me
column4: in thy justice~; because of my enemies direct my way in thy sight.

2 ^ Vèrba mea áŭribus pèrcipe: 10 ^ Qŭóniam non est in ore eórum vèritas~; cor eórum vanum est. ^ For there is no truth in their mouth~; their heart is vain.
11 ^ Sepùlcrum patens est guttur eórum~; lingŭîs suîs dolóse aǧébant~; júdica illos
Dòmine~; intèlleǧe clamórem meum. ^ Giv: Deus. Décidant a coǧitațiónibus suîs~; secùndum multitúdinem impietátum eórum expèlle eos
column4: Dòmine. ^ Their throat is an open sepulchre~; they dealt deceitfully with their tongues~; judge them
column5: O God. Let them fall from their devices~; according to the multitude of their wickednesses cast them out

2 ^ Vèrba mea áŭribus pèrcipe: 12 ^ Et laĕtèntur òmnes qŭi sperant in te~; in aĕtèrnum exsultábunt
Dòmine~; intèlleǧe clamórem meum. ^ Giv: et habitábis in eîs. Et gloriabùntur in te òmnes qŭi díliǧunt nomen tuum
^ But let all them be glad that hope in thee~; they shall rejoice for ever
column4: and thou shalt dwell in them. And all they that love thy name shall glory in thee

Dòmine~; intèlleǧe clamórem meum. ^ Giv: ut scuto bonaĕ voluntátis tuaĕ coronavìsti nos. ^ for thou wilt bless the just. O Lord
